entries.title: Tyre Nichols funeral: US Vice President joins mourners in Memphis
entries.description: The funeral of Tyre Nichols, the 29-year-old who died three days after being beaten by police officers, is taking place in Memphis, Tennessee.

entries.title: Court upholds decision to extend Andrew Tate's 30-day detention after appeal dismissed
entries.description: A Romanian court has upheld the decision to extend the detention of controversial influencer Andrew Tate to 30 days.

entries.title: LGBT activists welcome Pope to Congo as he dismisses anti-gay laws
entries.description: Pope Francis is being welcomed by gay rights activists as he begins a tour of Congo and South Sudan.

entries.title: Legendary NFL player Tom Brady 'retiring for good'
entries.description: NFL legend Tom Brady has announced for the second time that he will be retiring.

entries.title: Biggest year ever for crypto hacking - with North Korea the suspected culprit
entries.description: 2022 was the biggest year ever for cryptocurrency hacking, with more than £3.2bn stolen worldwide, according to new research.

entries.title: Couple jailed for 10 years over viral video showing them dancing at Iran landmark
entries.description: A young couple in Iran have been jailed for more than 10 years each after a video on social media showed them dancing at one of Tehran's main landmarks.

entries.title: Families seek exoneration of relatives convicted of witchcraft centuries later
entries.description: US politicians are considering exonerating 11 alleged witches who were executed and dozens more who were accused of having ties to Satan more than 375 years ago.

entries.title: FIFA facing backlash over potential 'sportswashing' Saudi sponsorship
entries.description: FIFA is facing backlash from Women's World Cup co-hosts Australia and New Zealand over a potential sponsorship of the tournament by Saudi Arabia.

entries.title: Pakistan seeks cash bailout as financial woes deepen after devastating floods
entries.description: Pakistan is in talks to release of $1.1bn (£890m) of cash from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to help ease its financial crisis.

entries.title: Dances With Wolves star arrested on suspicion of sexually assaulting young girls
entries.description: A star of the Oscar-winning film Dances With Wolves has been arrested on suspicion of sexually assaulting young indigenous girls in the US.

entries.title: Missing radioactive capsule found in Australian outback after huge search
entries.description: A radioactive capsule that fell off a truck in the Australian outback - sparking a radiation alert and a search of hundreds of miles of road - has been found.

entries.title: 14-year-old boy dies during his first rodeo bull ride
entries.description: A 14-year-old boy has died while riding a bull for the first time at a rodeo in North Carolina.

entries.title: Controversial internet personality Andrew Tate to appear in court in Romania
entries.description: Controversial internet personality Andrew Tate will appear in court in Romania on Wednesday as lawyers argue he should be released.
